container.heading: Arbitration of Labor Disputes, Elections, and Other Related Matters

para.text: The Commissioner of Labor and Industry, or the Commissioner's designee, shall be the hearing officer.
The hearing officer shall:
Call the title of the case;
Briefly explain the purpose and nature of the hearing;
Administer the oath to all persons who are summoned or intend to testify; and
Receive any stipulations entered into by the parties.
Counsel or any party may address any preliminary matter, exception, or motion.
The following exhibits shall be introduced:
If the hearing officer is the Commissioner's designee, a copy of the letter designating the individual to preside at the hearing;
A copy of the petition, complaint, or other matter involved in the hearing; and
A copy of the notice of hearing sent to each party.
Subject to applicable statutes and rules governing the practice of law, each party or counsel representing a party may:
Call witnesses;
Offer evidence, including rebuttal evidence;
Cross-examine witnesses; and
Present argument and summation.
The hearing officer may question any witness.
The rules of evidence of the Administrative Procedure Act—Contested Cases, State Government Article, §10-208, Annotated Code of Maryland, shall apply.
The hearing officer's decision shall include:
Findings of fact based on the evidence presented;
Conclusions of law applying the law to the factual findings; and
An order disposing of the case.
The hearing officer shall promptly deliver or mail a copy of the decision to each party or the party's attorney of record.
